Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expresses feelings of anxiety regarding job hunting and has applied to a couple of jobs but is still waiting for responses.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient feels overwhelmed by the idea of returning to school while balancing work and family responsibilities. They have been trying to cope with anxiety related to job applications and the waiting period.
Psychosocial History: The patient has been actively researching local programs for social work, spending quality time with their children, and engaging in reading activities together, which has strengthened their bond.
Current Functional Status: The patient is managing to dedicate time to family and is considering how to balance school with their responsibilities.
Progress Evaluation: The patient shows positive engagement with their children and is exploring educational opportunities, indicating a proactive approach to personal development.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is encouraged to use mindfulness techniques and to take breaks when needed to manage stress.
Next Steps: The patient will dedicate time to job searching and celebrate small victories in the process.
